snippet: Matteo Renzi will become the prime minister and has promised to change election laws so that voters can have a clearer say about who becomes premier in the future.
abstract: Italy is facing appointment of its third unelected prime minister, Matteo Renzi, after resignation of Enrico Letta; Renzi has promised to shatter politics of old guard and to change election laws to better reflect will of voters; some fear, however, that Renzi represents personality-driven political style associated with disgraced former Prime Min Silvio Berlusconi.
lead_paragraph: Matteo Renzi will become the prime minister and has promised to change election laws so that voters can have a clearer say about who becomes premier in the future.

headline.main: A Berlusconi Reminder as Italy Faces Another Unelected Premier
headline.print_headline: A Berlusconi Reminder as Italy Faces Another Unelected Premier
